author: amerkay
description: PowerLoop for Farmbot: Loop your farmbot by plants with search filters, or by automatic waypoint calculation to cover Plant search results grid area. Features include executing sequences and saving meta data. The code is as annotated as could be, so have a look at https://github.com/amerkay/powerloop/

config.name: pointname
config.label: Filter by plant name, case insensitive. 'aru' matches 'Arugula', * for all.
help: Uses string contains.

config.name: openfarm_slug
config.label: Filter by Openfarm slug name, case insensitive. 'aru' matches 'Arugula', * for all.

config.name: age_min_day
config.label: Filter by plant age (minimum days)

config.name: age_max_day
config.label: Filter by plant age (maximum days)

config.name: filter_meta_key
config.label: Filter by meta data : key

config.name: filter_meta_op
config.label: Filter by meta data : operator (==,!=,>,<,>=,<=,regex,daysmin,daysmax,minutesmin,minutesmax)
help: Default: '==' equals (numeric/string)
'!=' different (numeric/string)
'>' superior (numeric)
'<' inferior (numeric)
'>=' superior or equal (numeric)
'<=' inferior or equal (numeric)
'regex' regular expression
'daysmin' minimum days number from now to include plant (datetime)
'daysmax' maximum days number from now to include plant (datetime)
'minutesmin' minimum minutes number from now to include plant (datetime)
'minutesmax' maximum minutes number from now to include plant (datetime).

config.name: filter_meta_value
config.label: Filter by meta data : value

config.name: filter_plant_stage
config.label: Filter by plant stage (Allowed: None, planned, planted, sprouted, harvested)

config.name: filter_min_x
config.label: Filter by coordinates - Min X

config.name: filter_max_x
config.label: Filter by coordinates - Max X

config.name: filter_min_y
config.label: Filter by coordinates - Min Y

config.name: filter_max_y
config.label: Filter by coordinates - Max Y

config.name: sequence_init
config.label: Init Sequences, one-time execution. Eg. 'SeqName1, SeqName2'
help: Default: 'None' -> no execute sequence
Sequence name matched using equals, case-insensitive.
Can be an ordered list of sequences with ',' seperator. Eg. 'Seq1,Seq2,...'

config.name: sequence_beforemove
config.label: Sequences Before Next Move, for each plant. Eg. 'SeqName1, SeqName2'
help: Default: 'None' -> no execute sequence
Sequence name matched using equals, case-insensitive.
Can be an ordered list of sequences with ',' seperator. Eg. 'Seq1,Seq2,...'

config.name: sequence_aftermove
config.label: Sequences After Move, for each plant. Eg. 'SeqName1, SeqName2'
help: Default: 'None' -> no execute sequence
Sequence name matched using equals, case-insensitive.
Can be an ordered list of sequences with ',' seperator. Eg. 'Seq1,Seq2,...'

config.name: sequence_end
config.label: End Sequences, one-time execution. Eg. 'SeqName1, SeqName2'
help: Default: 'None' -> no execute sequence
Sequence name matched using equals, case-insensitive.
Can be an ordered list of sequences with ',' seperator. Eg. 'Seq1,Seq2,...'

config.name: save_meta_key
config.label: Save in meta data : key

config.name: save_meta_value
config.label: Save in meta data : value (str / #NOW#)

config.name: save_plant_stage
config.label: Set plant stage (None, planned, planted, sprouted, harvested)
help: If planted, 'planted_at' property is changed to now UTC (like web app)

config.name: offset_x
config.label: Offset X value when moving - (integer, randint(i,j))
help: Optional: set to 'randint(i,j)' no quotes, returns a random integer N such that i <= N <= j.

config.name: offset_y
config.label: Offset Y value when moving - (integer, randint(i,j))
help: Optional: set to 'randint(i,j)' no quotes, returns a random integer N such that i <= N <= j.

config.name: default_z
config.label: Default Z axis value when moving

config.name: default_speed
config.label: Default speed value when moving. Percent of max speed (1-100)

config.name: use_tsp_greedy
config.label: Use Travelling Salesman Problem Greedy algorithm to optimize route? If 'True', no quotes, TSP Greedy Algorithm will be used (default True).
help: Default: True -> use TSPGreedy, rather than sort(x,y). See README, Fig. 1.

config.name: grid_coverage_per_step
config.label: Grid coverage (x, y) per step. None to disable (default), set to enable. E.g camera fov '(220, 310)'. When used, no point data will be saved.
help: Default: 'None' to disable grid coverage. Uses the default plant search and filter for the points data.

Grid coverage (x, y) per step. E.g for camera field of view enter '(200, 280)', no quotes, depending on your z axis height for camera FoV. If set it uses the results of Plant filtering, then calculates waypoints based on grid_coverage_per_step value.

config.name: debug
config.label: Debug mode (0-> No FW debug msg, 1-> FW debug msg (default), 2-> No move/exec - do save point data, 3-> simulation, log only)
help: 0 -> no farmware debug log
1 -> farmware debug log
2 -> no move, no execute sequences. Do save point data and farmware debug log
3 -> simulation mode. No move, no execute sequence, no save meta data. Enable farmware debug log
